p: Tumor associated angiogenesis plays a crucial role in the growth and metastasis of tumor [ 26]. To determine the effect of EECP on angiogenesis in vitro, HUVECs were treated with different concentrations of EECP (25, 50, and 100 μg/mL) for 6 h. Compared with the LPS group, endothelial cell tube formation abilities were significantly decreased after treatment with EECP. Correspondingly, the numbers of tubes and tube branches were significantly decreased in a dose-dependent manner after EECP treatment, suggesting that EECP probably inhibits tumor angiogenesis ( ∗ P < 0.05, ∗∗ P < 0.01; Figures 2(e)–(g)).
